messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:50): now that Vlad is suggesting dashing, it would be interesting to hear from the canvas implementors at Opera and Apple if they'd be ok with adding dashes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:50): adding this to canvas when canvas is so poorly implemented at this stage would be stupid
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:50): every browser is swimming in bugs and unimplemented features already
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:51): adding more stuff will just make it even less likely that we'll reach the sort of quality point we need for exiting CR
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: agreed, canvas is suffering from poor interoperability

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:01): which is interesting since in theory, canvas should be the area of the spec where you could get the most interop per unit of effort (because the back end imaging model is well understood and old)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): it's the area of the spec with the most interop, i think
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): but it would only get worse if we added more features at this stage, imho
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): i mean, if the vendors think we should, i'll bow to pressure, but it just seems stupid to me
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (12:10): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Some of the interop problems in canvas are a result of different interpretations of spec text, I believe
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (12:11): so we need some spec how to read the spec? 8-)
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (12:12): 3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1: you mean you want formal grammar for a spec language
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:12): the spec text is improving
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (12:12): indeed it is
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:13): 3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1: the spec already says that it should be read forwards, backwards and in pieces
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:24): good morning to all
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: ping?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:31): hey
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:35): hey 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, i was surprised to read your replies to my very old emails
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:35): yeah, i'm going through all the feedback we received
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:36): very good, thanks for the replies

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:49): 5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff: btw in case i have other e-mails from you, i apologise in advance if i send the replies to the wrong address. i don't look at who wrote the e-mail when i reply to them, i just hit "reply all", write the reply, fix the spec if needed, and send the mail.
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: absolutely no problem
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:50): i understand that
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:51): i just mentioned the email address change, in case others reply
5118b8399f69ec9afb5e3e54b6696bff (12:51): i can no longer reply from the old email account - it's not subscribed to the ML
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:52): offtopic for the svn users: does svn integration actually work these days in eclipse?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:52): uses SVN but not Eclipse :)
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (12:53): http://subclipse.tigris.org/ looks so

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:53): *working* Eclipse integration is a must-have for me. I'm considering whether I should put the new html parser code in the schema CVS repo or start a new svn repo
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:54): 3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1: have you tried subclipse lately?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:54): my experience of subclipse is from two years ago and back then it was unacceptably b0rked
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (12:54): looks its from same people like tortoiseSVN which i am using
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:54): right, bed time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:54): nn
